page.title: 10FARMING AND RURAL LIFE
page.content: Mixed Farming is predominant in the area. Arable crops include barley, wheat, potatoes, silage, hay and oil seed rape. Court Farm has pedigree herds of Jersey Cattle and Long Horn _ the latter breed was common in the 18th century and is now becoming more popular. There is also a well known stud farm at Limbury Stud specialising in the production of event horses. Horse and Pony Shows take place at Limbury and Tweenhills. P. Western at Groveside produces fences for Horse Shows. Foxes are hunted by Ledbury, and Cotswold Vale Hunts from November _ March each year. Hares are hunted by Leadon Vale Basset Hounds. Horticulture is also important, with six nurseries specialising in different plants e.g. tomatoes, lettuces, alpines and annuals.
